attributes.action: Increase funding & testing of pulmonary fibrosis & idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis
attributes.background: Idiopathic Pulmonary fibrosis is a condition in which the lung tissue becomes thickened, stiff & scarred over a period of time. The lungs lose their ability to transfer oxygen into the bloodstream. As a result, the brain and other organs don’t get the oxygen they need.
attributes.additional_details:
Men are nearly twice as likely as women to suffer from IPF.
There are 5000 new cases of IPF every year in the UK.
50% of IPF sufferers die within 3 years of diagnosis.
More than 30,000 people will be diagnosed with IPF in the EU each year.
IPF is more common than all leukaemias combined. Treatment options for pulmonary fibrosis are limited as the disease is progressive. The prognosis is poor for pulmonary fibrosis. The survival (life expectancy) for most patients is less than 5 years.

attributes.action: Ban the terrier men's terriers from trail hunts.
attributes.background: Since the Fox Hunting Ban in 2004, the terrier men are now simply there to lay the trail. The terriers are no longer necessary. Terriers were only used to flush out foxes before the ban.
attributes.additional_details:
The artificial scents that hunts lay should not lead into a badger sett or into a hole in the ground.
In traditional foxhunting the terriermen were used to stop/block fox earths and badger setts in the area where the hunting was to take place to prevent foxes from going to ground. The foxes would be located using terriers, dug out and fox bolted to be hunted again by the hounds. It's hard to imagine which roles terriers could now play in trail hunting and shouldn't be found with trail hunts.

attributes.action: Make entering and occupying land without consent a criminal offence
attributes.background: Removing trespassers from public and private land is a lengthy process. Damage and disruption caused during this time, especially to the local environment are often irreparable and subsequent clean-up operations costly. Currently, repeat offenders simply move on to the next available open space.
attributes.additional_details:
Making this a criminal offence will give police the powers to.
- Arrest without warrant.
- Remove, store and dispose of objects.
- Issue penalties and proceedings.

Other countries already have provision in law for this.

In Ireland, the Criminal Justice (Public Order) Act, 1994, was amended in 2002 to address this issue.

attributes.action: To allow psv Licence holders to upgrade free to a class 2 lorry licence.
attributes.background: As a psv driver, you are driving vehicles that are longer than a class 2 lorry. And busses can weigh a lot more than a lorry as well. With a bus you are carrying precious cargo (passengers) so why can you not allow a psv licence holder to be allowed an automatic right to a class 2 licence.
attributes.additional_details: There is a huge shortage of hgv drivers within the UK. So surely by allowing a psv licence holder the right to a class 2 lorry licence, without the need of a further driving exam would make a lot of sense.

attributes.action: Prevent developers & land speculators from “gaming the system” in UK housing.
attributes.background:
Change the five year land supply to develop the right number of houses in the right places in accordance with a sustainable, relevant and up-to-date Local Plan.
Introduce a local measure of pipeline & delivery of homes to ensure that non-performing developers or land speculators can be identified.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting the right homes in the right places:
Where an LPA can openly show a supply of undelivered housing or land that exceeds a six year horizon to cover local population growth, there shall be no rights of appeal on the basis of land supply.
Measuring the pipeline and delivery of homes:
Where new homes aren’t registered with the LPA at a rate in accordance with plans set out and agreed with that LPA, then DCLG shall have the right to declare the developers / land speculators as non-performing.

attributes.action: Fund Universities to explore new routes into Learning Disability Nursing
attributes.background: In order to ensure those with Learning Disabilities receive the best evidence-based care it is vital money is invested into developing new, affordable routes into nurse education to meet the needs of the Learning Disability Student demographic.
attributes.additional_details: Since the loss of student nursing bursaries in England, there has been a marked decline in the number of applicants to pre-registration Learning Disability Nursing courses. Applications from mature students, who have traditionally made up a large percentage of Learning Disability Nursing intakes, have fallen most drastically. This fall in applications is resulting in university courses across the country closing, threatening the future of the Learning Disability Nursing workforce.

attributes.action: To consider the removal of parental responsibility for absent parents.
attributes.background: As a single parent, I believe I should behold the right to make decisions based on the benefit of my child solely as her primary and only care giver.
attributes.additional_details: For example, if an absent father makes the choice to pay no attention their child, I don’t think it's acceptable for any single parent to have to resort to permission from said father regarding decisions the mother wishes to make such as health, schooling and country of residency, if it will work in the best interests of the child.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single use plastic straws and cutlery in England
attributes.background:
The UK uses an estimated 8.5 million straw each years, which are amongst the top 10 items found in beach clean ups.

Plastic is damaging our ecosystem, not only killing animals, but also micro-plastics have been found in all water sources across the world - thought to be damaging to our health.
attributes.additional_details: Banning single use straws and cutlery across the UK would enable us to make a move towards environmental improvement.

attributes.action: Grant leave to remain to Brenda Ackerman and change the Immigration Rules
attributes.background: Brenda is a frail 71-yr-old South African who is at risk of being removed to SA. Brenda has been living with her daughter, British son-in-law and 19 & 16-yr-old granddaughters since 2006 & is dependent on them & they on her. Her removal risks resulting in “intense suffering” & “large risk of death”.
attributes.additional_details: Since July 2012, the immigration rules have made it almost impossible for British citizens to bring their elderly parents to the UK to care for them. As Brenda’s barrister, I am calling on the Govt to change the Immigration Rules to the pre-2012 Immigration Rules which allowed British nationals and other settled persons to be joined by their parents/grandparents aged 65 & over if they could accommodate and maintain them without reliance on public funds to avoid situations like Brenda's arising.

attributes.action: To abolish ground rent payments on existing residential property leases
attributes.background:
1)Ground rent is a form of exploitation, particularly when it is set to double over the life of a lease every 10,15,20 or 25 years

2)The government supports setting ground rent to zero on new leases: a disparity of treatment between old and new leases would put existing leases at disadvantage
attributes.additional_details:
No service is essentially provided in return for ground rent payments

Freeholders already receive an income when lease is extended 

Setting ground rent to zero would likely reduce rent charged to tenants by leaseholder landlords

As an alternative the government should set the maximum ground rent to £200 per year over the life of the lease

Leasehold properties with increasing ground rents are more difficult to sell as lenders are reluctant to approve mortgages to buy these properties

attributes.action: Don't merge the Parachute Regiment units with the Royal Marines Units.
attributes.background:
We are launching a petition against the proposals to merge the Parachute Regiment units and Royal Marines units.

We must put a stop to the government destroying our Armed Forces.

We do not want the government to merge these units and we do not want any more cuts to be made on our Armed Forces.

attributes.action: Require local authorities to adopt all Public Open Space and roads on estates
attributes.background: Local authorities are avoiding increasing their grounds maintenance responsibilities on new private estates by requiring developers to form management companies to deal with the maintenance long term. These management fees are an extra tax on hard working families. Councils should adopt the land.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities used to be paid commuted sums by housing developers to adopt open land and roads. Local authorities would be responsible for the long term maintenance for these assets. In practice, management companies are established for some roads and public open spaces to be maintained long term. Management companies charge excessive amounts for in effect a second “council tax”. The government should force all local authorities to adopt all roads and public open space on private estates.

attributes.action: Make Autistic Spectrum Disorder widely known about within the DWP Assessments.
attributes.background: Regardless of where on the Autistic Spectrum an individual is, low or high functioning, they are similar but all have different needs. The biggest problem all ASD sufferers have in common is social and communication skills.
attributes.additional_details: It's a condition that one is born with and it will never not be there. There isn't medication to lessen the symptoms of Autism or to control them. There is a lack of education with the very people we put our trust in. The DWP response to a Freedom of Information (FOI) request stated 80% of Mandatory reconsiderations are rejected as performance indicators. That's almost 9 out of 10 people! There is much needed information being missed out in assessments where invisible illnesses are concerned.

attributes.action: Abolish the 3-month rule so that people receiving chemotherapy can obtain PIP
attributes.background: Under the 3 month rule, I don't qualify for PIP. I’m therefore living with debilitating stage 4 Cancer whilst trying to get by on SSP and donations. As cancer now affects one in two people, PIP must be made available to all patients receiving chemotherapy, as this is when we need financial support.
attributes.additional_details: Respected charities acknowledge cancer results in an immediate increase in expenses. When it’s cold, there are increased heating costs. Eating a healthy and varied diet is expensive.  Patients suffer from extreme fatigue and many have to swallow their pride by asking for help performing very basic and personal tasks.  There’s also an array of appointments to keep that result in additional transport costs. Having cancer is therefore not only frightening and degrading, it’s also expensive.

attributes.action: Extend the 'Recall of MPs Act 2015'
attributes.background:
The Recall of MPs Act 2015 needs to be extended so that those MPs who go against the will of their own constituents can be recalled.

How can it be a representative democracy if our MPs are allowed to go against the will of the people who elect them to represent them?
attributes.additional_details: Failing to represent those who elect them is as much a travesty as any of the current reasons given for calling for a Recall of any of our elected representatives but at this time the Recall of MPs Act 2015 does not cover such an eventuality and those signing this petition feel that it should.

attributes.action: Automatic Settlement Rights to the Elderly Parents of the British Citizens
attributes.background: Elderly parents/relatives should be given an automatic right to settle in the UK subject to their UK family’s ability to maintain and accommodate them without recourse to the public funds.
attributes.additional_details: In the past few years, the immigration rules have made it virtually impossible for the elderly dependent parents/relatives of the British citizen to settle in the UK. This has led to the elderly parents forced to leave the UK and/or refusal of their entry clearance application resulting them living alone without the vital physical and emotional support. A change in the law is well overdue to make sure that they live with the dignity that they deserve in the most vulnerable years of their lives with their loved ones.

attributes.action: Increase compulsory school age to 7
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest compulsory school ages in the world, and yet is behind other countries academically. Starting school at age 4 has a negative impact on children's education often leading to children being labelled with having additional needs when in reality they are simply not ready.

attributes.action: Give working mums support to pay child care for children between birth - 3yrs
attributes.background: I am a new working mum and I can not believe how expensive child care is, working on the national minimal wage how are mums able to work to cover child care costs when it takes over 3/4 of their wage. Why penalise the people who WANT to work

attributes.action: UK to raise the state pension to the OECD figure of 63% of average earnings.
attributes.background:
The OECD reports that the UK has the lowest state pension of any OECD country. 
This is a disgrace.
I ask for a full parliamentary debate on the issue.
UK workers retire on about 29% of average earnings, the average OECD figure is 63%.
All developed EU countries pay their pensioners more.
attributes.additional_details:
A political consensus was reached by EU Nations at the Laeken Summit in 2001, that each member state, would attempt to attain a Basic Pension of 40% of average earnings by 2007 and then work towards 60%.
In 2017 the UK state pension was £7,440.
France £15,811.
Germany £26,366.
Spain £26,630.
By 2050 Germany and Spain plan devoting 16% of GDP to Basic State Pensions. 
The UK looks likely to be still devoting only 4% of GDP. 
UK politicians should not ignore such massive pension differences.

attributes.action: Make St Georges Day a Bank Holiday in England.
attributes.background:
A nation’s patron Saint should be celebrated. 

England is one of a very select few who do not hold the privilege of being granted their National Patron Saints day off work as a Bank Holiday.

attributes.action: The EU referendum result must be dismissed as not fit for purpose
attributes.background: On its own admission, the government should have included a double majority as a criterion for implementing the EU referendum result. In 2015 in a debate on an SNP amendment requiring this and other safeguards, David Lidington stated that these were not necessary as the referendum was advisory only.
attributes.additional_details: The obvious conclusion we can draw from this is that the government believed that a binding referendum would require these checks and balances. David Cameron then proceeded to change the status of the referendum to binding by promising to implement the result but failed to change the majority criteria. We do not believe that a 3.8% majority, after a shameful campaign, is a mandate for such a huge constitutional change, nor the dismissal of 48% of the electorate, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

attributes.action: make it a legal requirement that all hunting dogs on a hunt should be muzzled.
attributes.background:
Hounds are killing foxes on trail and drag hunts. Where they may follow a live fox scent or come across a fox.
They are also on occasions attacking pet dogs and other wildlife.
They can be very intimidating to general public also.
By having these hunting dogs muzzled would prevent any incidents.

attributes.action: Make it legal requirement to publish carbohydrate values of food in restaurants
attributes.background:
Over 4 million people in the UK have Diabetes.
In order to give the correct dose of Insulin with a meal, it's imperative to have accurate carbohydrate values available.
Without this, a diabetic is forced to guess and could either under/over medicate which can cause life threatening complications!

attributes.action: Fund and support a monument to the POLISH PILOT HEROES of the Battle of Britain.
attributes.background: Let’s build a 30 metre high dramatic memorial in Central London to the heroic Polish Pilots in the Battle of Britain 1940. Nor were the Poles invited to the British Victory Parade when the War ended. The proposed monument is a great opportunity to thank them for their sacrifice & dedication.
attributes.additional_details: IT’S THE POLES WHO WON IT! 303 POLISH SQUADRON: - Highest scoring in the whole RAF. - High scoring RAF Ace of Aces pilot. With 302 Polish Squadron shot down 60% of German planes on Battle of Britain Day. This decisive Polish contribution to victory needs to be known and celebrated.

attributes.action: Scrap the cap on international doctors being allowed to work in the NHS
attributes.background: We call for the removal of visa restrictions preventing international doctors from working in the UK. Since Dec 2017 over 1500 visa applications from doctors who have secured NHS jobs have been refused. Meanwhile 100s of posts are vacant, waiting times are rising and patient safety is under threat.
attributes.additional_details:
Denying doctors who have secured jobs in the NHS from entering the UK does not make sense. Hospitals are wasting money on recruitment and are being forced to cover shifts with locum doctors - if they can find them. 
Gaps in rotas mean doctors are juggling large numbers of patients and stress among the profession is rising.  
International doctors are ready to work in the NHS. Scrap the cap and let them take up their posts. 
https://www.bmj.com/scrap-the-cap

attributes.action: Dogs under S1 DDA should automatically be entitled to interim exemption
attributes.background: The Dangerous Dogs Act (s1) prohibits ownership of certain dogs. Any dog suspected to be a banned breed it is likely to be seized by the police and kept in a police kennel. If the court finds the dog is a banned breed but it is not deemed a danger, it may be exempted (subject to restrictions).
attributes.additional_details: The police have the power to issue an interim exemption pending the courts decision. However, this is entirely at their discretion and how this is dealt with varies between forces. Where a dog is only being pursued as a result of how they look, this interim exemption should be automatic (where the restrictions can be put in place and adhered to). Spending long periods in kennels can detrimental to the welfare of a dog and the owner.

attributes.action: Enshrine in law that foreign nationals hold medical insurance before entry to UK
attributes.background: The NHS is free at point of contact for all. Foreign Nationals often use the NHS then leave the country without paying for treatment. I therfore petition parliament to enshrine in law that ALL Foreigners should hold medical insurance and must prove that they hold this before entering the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The UK needs to look after the NHS and nurture it. We have the finest health care system in the world. But it can no longer cope with the influx and lack of funding. Making sure that foreign nationals have health insurance before they enter the UK will help elevate some of the funding issues the NHS currently has. It will also eliminate health tourism and free up appointments that are much needed for UK Nationals.

attributes.action: Give all Ancient Woodland statutory legal protection.
attributes.background: Ancient Woodland is a nationally important wildlife habitat in its own right, acting as a natural flood defence air filter and carbon store, while providing homes for species that depend on it for survival. Once it's gone it's gone, legal protection should be brought in line with SSSIs as a minimum.
attributes.additional_details: With 13% of the UK's landmass covered in woodland, compared to the EU average of around 35% we are significantly lagging behind our European counterparts. We must protect our ancient woodlands as part of a program of woodland expansion that will help us to reduce the concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere and slow the progress of rainwater, reducing flooding downstream. Expanding will help reverse the decline of woodland species as highlighted by the UK State of Nature Report 2016.

attributes.action: Debate effect of pumping out brine at Fleetwood on marine life and livelihoods
attributes.background: Consent has been given for brine to be pumped out at Fleetwood.  Pumping will continue for years, whilst they build underground gas storage caverns. Local experts have concerns about the possible effects on our delicate marine ecology and on local livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details:
There are concerns relating to conservation; the food chain; fishing industry; tourism; polluted water from Fleetwood dock; and the accuracy of dispersal modelling.

We call for a parliamentary debate on the brine discharge and on whether the benefits of this project for the UK outweigh the possible negative impacts on the local area.

attributes.action: Programme to fund aspiring commercial pilots training similar to university fees
attributes.background: Training fees for aspiring commercial pilots can be huge, with some of the most costly courses ranging up to £125,000. Currently there is no widely available method for people in the UK to help fund their training. We propose that the Government provide a funding scheme for future pilots.
attributes.additional_details:
The current lack of a pilot loan scheme means that pilots from the UK are at a competitive disadvantage compared to those from other countries, e.g some Scandinavian countries, where a scheme is provided.
BALPA, representing over 75% of UK pilots, recently voiced concerns on this matter, stating that pilot training should be more accessible (http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/airline-pilots-rich-cost-training-poor-students-industry-warn-british-airline-pilots-association-a7899886.html#r3z-addoor)
An important point is that some schemes incrementally repay a large percentage (up to 60%) of the fee back on completion of training.

attributes.action: Make diagnosis enough for children with SEN to get the help and provision needed
attributes.background: Throughout the UK there are thousands of children struggling in mainstream school. My son is one of many. He is Aspergers/ADHD. He needs a specialist provision and one on one support. He and all of the other children are made to fail the system before they qualify for help. Something needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
* Diagnosis should be enough for a specialist provision
* Support should be given immediately to children whose parents choose for them to stay in mainstream
* Children have to fail in mainstream before they can get assistance, the system is failing our children
* EHCP process takes too long
* Funding needs to be increased
* We need more specialist schools
* ALL children deserve the right to an education in a setting that suits their needs.
* SEN Children need SEN support

attributes.action: Don't change how Parliament’s popular and successful guided tours are run
attributes.background: For 18 years, Parliament tours have been led by professional Blue Badge Guides and experienced in-house guides. The tours have won awards and Parliament is top rated on TripAdvisor. Tours generate income for Parliament. Under new proposals 200+ professionals will stop receiving work from Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The House authorities plan to replace the current qualified guides with a downsized team. In our view, the case for this change is based on inaccurate information and flawed financial analysis. MPs and Peers have declared their support for our campaign. The proposals also call for substantial investment in a plan to guide in a building facing closure for refurbishment in seven years' time. We believe that this proposal is misguided and does not represent a good use of taxpayers' money.

attributes.action: Water safety/drowning prevention & effects of cold water to be taught in schools
attributes.background: In 2016 we saw the launch of the first ever water safety strategy in the UK which aims to reduce water related fatalities by 50% by 2026. Collaboration, awareness, education and prevention are the main focuses.
attributes.additional_details: Like many others i learned the hard way my 1st born son lost his life swimming in open water aged 13. The 1st time I heard the words "cold water shock" was when I was looking up how my physically fit son could have died. I started visiting schools in my son's memory to teach the dangers in & around open water my son was not alone in not knowing the dangers in fact he was part of a majority. This needs to change water safety/ drowning prevention needs to be a part of our national curriculum now!

attributes.action: Prohibit the removal of trees/shrubs from riverbanks & in-river wildlife habitat
attributes.background: Vital wildlife habitat for protected species like otters bats & water voles is regularly destroyed plus nesting sites for birds & refuges for fish from predation.This is carried out without the threat of prosecution. Such actions must be licensed & subject to full environmental impact assessments.
attributes.additional_details: The Angling Trust has highlighted many situations where important habitat has been removed and even on occasion found evidence of the EA removing habitat that they themselves had helped to install. Landowners and the EA need clear incentives to manage riverine environments for the maximum benefit of wildlife.  Modern flood defense strategies have failed to look at the impact on river habitat removal and the wildlife that depends on it for its survival.

attributes.action: Remove shortage occupation codes and NHS roles from Tier 2 Visa cap
attributes.background: Since December 2017, the points required to obtain a Restricted Certificate of Sponsorship (RCOS) has more than doubled - from 21 points (for nearly the entire history of the points based system) to 46 - 55 points. The months long breaching of this cap is negatively impacting NHS and business needs.
attributes.additional_details:
Removal NHS roles from the RCOS cap will allow swifter entrance for badly needed NHS staff including doctors, therapists, and key support positions, helping to ease the growing pressures faced by the service. 

Additionally, removal of the shortage occupation codes will allow businesses to more fairly compete for international talent. 

See below:

http://www.bbc.com/news/health-43898969 

https://www.peoplemanagement.co.uk/news/articles/businesses-unable-recruit-overseas-visa-limit-breached

attributes.action: Abolish the house of lords.
attributes.background:
The unelected house of lords are going against the will of the British people. 17.4 million voters want a brexit consisting of leaving the single market & leaving the customs union.
The house of lords wish to block this therefore they must be abolished.

attributes.action: Make General Dental Council (GDC) a tax-payer funded organisation.
attributes.background:
The General Dental Councils remit is to work for patients whilst working with dentists.
It is now time for the funding of this body to be reviewed and for it to be paid for out of general taxation.

attributes.action: Keep the rights of EU27 + EFTA citizens already in the UK unchanged after Brexit
attributes.background: Before the EU referendum Vote Leave said: “There will be no change for EU citizens already lawfully resident in the UK. These EU citizens will automatically be granted indefinite leave to remain in the UK and will be treated no less favourably than they are at present.” (1 June 2016).
attributes.additional_details:
This statement was signed by Boris Johnson, Michael Gove, Gisela Stuart and Priti Patel. This promise has not been kept despite Michael Gove and Boris Johnson being government ministers. 
EU27 citizens living in the UK will have to apply for settled status so reducing their current rights, for example by ending their right to return to the UK after more than five years absence and ending European Court of Justice oversight of citizens’ rights. There is currently no guarantee of voting rights.

attributes.action: Provide Medway funding to build Abbey court special needs secondary school
attributes.background: Abbey court is the only school in medway which caters for profoundly disabled children.There is not enough places at the secondary school due to it being to small and not purpose built for disabled children. We are calling on the government to help fund the build of a secondary school
attributes.additional_details: Abbey court primary moved to a new site in 2017. Medway ran out of money to build the secondary site(land and permission to build is there).Medway stipulated that abbey court primary has to take on ex amount of extra pupils per year, which had now caused there not to be enough secondary spaces therefor our children will be sent out of borough or placed in residential school miles away from loved ones or pulled out of the education system. Every child has a right to education disabled or not

attributes.action: An Independent Commission into the Home Office and the "hostile environment"
attributes.background:
The Windrush Scandal and Amber Rudd’s resignation have shown the chaotic and cruel way the Home Office operates.
 
This crisis was caused by Theresa May’s “hostile environment” policy. The policy ruins lives, puts people at risk of destitution and removal, and increases the risk of modern slavery.
attributes.additional_details:
It asks landlords and doctors to act as border guards and there is no evidence that the policy works.

Migrants and those who look or sound 'foreign' are at most risk. 

We can no longer trust that the Home Office can function effectively and fairly.

We need an Independent Commission to look into the behaviour of the Home Office and its “hostile environment”. It is the only way to ensure that all those caught up in Theresa May’s “hostile environment” are protected.

attributes.action: Kids with allergies must have a right to eat safe food from home at eateries.
attributes.background: We were recently humiliated and almost refused service when we brought home made food for our son, who has life threatening allergies, to a play centre. We believe that this is a form of discrimination. Parents should have the right to provide safe food for their children without being shamed.
attributes.additional_details: Since my experience, I have discovered many other similar stories where parents are publicly shamed. We are an invisible group who are discriminated against but have no protection under the law. We would like to enjoy going out as a family knowing that our children are safe.

attributes.action: I would like all military veterans to receive free train travel in the UK
attributes.background:
To support current military veterans and homeless veterans with free travel on trains within the UK to support with social, mental welfare and support.
Reducing stress, anxiety and the chance to mix with likeminded persons who may also be suffering with issues from leaving the services.
attributes.additional_details: Currently veterans will meet annually to mix with old comrades and to get the feeling of support that we don’t feel we get from our normal lives. The people missing from these events are the homeless Vets and PTSD suffers who struggle on a daily basis. I see this as an area that other Vets can support struggling veterans with one to one meetings or planned events. This could reduce suicides and reduce strains on the NHS. The number of travel could be set minimum of 3 per year.

attributes.action: Mandatory training in ALL aspects of Domestic abuse for Family courts & Cafcass.
attributes.background:
Judiciary, Cafcass & Family court to be fully trained in domestic abuse, gas lighting, coercive control, stalking, sexual abuse, financial abuse, emotional abuse, harassment and its effects on the Family. 
70-90% of Family court & Cafcass cases involve DA.
Training would enable informed decisions
attributes.additional_details:
Daily decisions are made on recommendations by Cafcass for contact with perpetrators enforced by courts affecting families.

15 children were murdered in 2015 during contact that was enforced.

Training is essential for the safeguarding of all children and survivors.

http://safelives.org.uk/sites/default/files/resources/SafeLives%20Annual%20Impact%20Report%202016-17_web.pdf

https://www.naccc.org.uk/downloads/NewsItems/APPG_Inquiry_report_Domestic_Abuse_Child_Contact_and_the_Family_Court.pdf

attributes.action: Make burning or mistreating a Union Jack in public a criminal offence.
attributes.background: There is nothing more offensive to loyal British subjects than seeing protesters destroying our nation's flag. It elicits feelings of anger and revulsion and can be a precursor to violence. It is not unreasonable to expect our nation's flag to be treated with respect.

attributes.action: Parliament debate whether Israel has 'improper influence' over British Politics
attributes.background: Theresa May has 'rejected' calls, from the leader of the opposition party, for a public inquiry, into alleged 'improper influences' in British politics by Israel. This is wrong.
attributes.additional_details: An investigation revealed plots by the Israeli diplomat to destroy the careers of numerous senior politicians. It is only on the basis of an investigation that Parliament and the British public will be reassured that such activities will not be tolerated by ANY British government. Therefore, and due to the Mrs May's outright rejection of a public inquiry into the matter, I feel it is deemed necessary to debate whether Israel has improper influence over British politics.

attributes.action: Keep freedom of movement for UK and EU Citizens as part of Brexit EU trade deal
attributes.background: The Leave side won the EU referendum in 2016, but there are voters on both sides who wish to keep EU freedom of movement rights post Brexit.  Freedom of movement is also essential for the NHS and companies across the UK and EU, we must fight to maintain it. Please sign if you agree.
attributes.additional_details: As the March 29th 2019 Brexit withdrawal deadline draws ever closer we must act before it's too late to save Freedom of movement rights for UK and EU Citizens post Brexit.  Think about the future and the opportunities that EU freedom of movement rights offer with the ability to work, live, study and retire across the EU 28.

attributes.action: If no agreement on the Ireland Border can be reached, Brexit must be abandoned.
attributes.background: Peace in Northern Ireland is a valuable achievement, given decades of sectarian violence before 1998. No vague promises of benefits on Brexit can compensate for losing this. Allowing for consultation with the other states, if no settlement  by 1 October, we must withdraw Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a major concern for many of us here, and also many in the Irish Republic and the EU, that a `hard border' between the Irish Republic and Northern Ireland will cause serious unrest.

The Good Friday Agreement of 1998 ended the violence and terrorism. but this will return once customs and immigration controls are reimposed. It is reason enough to stop the process of leaving the EU. The safety of the British people is too important to be sacrificed for what is in reality vague promises

attributes.action: Rule that freeholders must cover safety related costs of their buildings
attributes.background: On June 14 2017, 71 people saw there lives cut short after the Grenfell Tower was destroyed by fire, and all survivors have seen their lives hopelessly changed. The same type of cladding, which played a key role in the tragedy by allowing the fire to spread, has been found on more than 250 blocks.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaseholders of many private blocks are being charged for all implemented measures, even though Sajid Javid, DCLG Secretary urged owners/management companies not to do so. Replacement works worth £millions won't start until funds are in place, endangering lives. 

Let’s join together to ask Government to rule formally that freeholders are responsible for costs of ensuring the safety of our buildings and provide economic support to guarantee prompt implementation of whatever measures needed.

attributes.action: The holiday  homes industry to have tighter, stricter regulations.
